medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and right upper quadrant abdominal pain for two days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started two days prior to admission after eating breakfast. It was severe, located in the epigastrium, and was associated with nausea and dry heaves. The patient did not eat anything else, went to work, and presented to the hospital due to continued pain. The pain is described as similar to a previous episode of pancreatitis. Currently, the patient reports feeling better, and the pain has decreased after receiving morphine.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes, Morbid obesity, Atrial fibrillation, History of CVA, Hypertension, History of pulmonary embolism and DVT, Status post IVC filter, Venous insufficiency.
